programme.title: Cop Land
programme.desc: The sheriff (Sylvester Stallone) of a small New Jersey police community confronts key men (Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta) on both sides of a law-enforcement cover-up.

programme.title: Glory
programme.desc: Col. Robert Gould Shaw (Matthew Broderick) trains and leads an all-black regiment during the U.S. Civil War.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Fred Straub returns to sue Bumpy for ownership of the St. Clair, but this time, he's backed by the Italian Mob; the Panthers intervene when Delia's son is drafted to Vietnam; Colombo makes an interesting proposal to Stella.

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: Jack Ryan (Ben Affleck) and the CIA director (Morgan Freeman) try to stop terrorists who are planning a nuclear attack.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible -- Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team must track down a terrifying new weapon that threatens all of humanity if it falls into the wrong hands. With control of the future and the fate of the world at stake, a deadly race around the globe begins.

programme.title: The Krays
programme.desc: Warped by their mother (Billie Whitelaw), cockney twins Ronald and Reginald Kray (Gary Kemp, Martin Kemp) become gangsters in 1950s London.

programme.title: This is Christmas
programme.desc: Following Adam and Emma on their daily commute from the village of Langton to London, where they meet the same passengers every day.

programme.title: Legally Blondes
programme.desc: British twin sisters (Milly Rosso, Becky Rosso) experience culture shock when they attend school in California.

programme.title: Summer Days, Summer Nights
programme.desc: On the south shore of Long Island in the summer of 1983, a group of working-class teenagers and 20-somethings work their summer jobs, fall in and out of love, and wrestle with what the future holds when the summer ends and the real world beckons.

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: A wheeler-dealer (Tom Cruise) meets his brother (Dustin Hoffman), an institutionalized autistic-savant, heir to $3 million.

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: JFK, LBJ, Vietnam, Watergate and other history unfold through the perspective of an Alabama man (Tom Hanks) with an IQ of 75.

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: A high-school baseball coach (Dennis Quaid) makes it to the Major Leagues as a middle-aged relief pitcher.

programme.title: Suspect Zero
programme.desc: With help from his former partner (Carrie-Anne Moss), an FBI agent (Aaron Eckhart) searches for a man (Ben Kingsley) who is hunting and murdering serial killers.

programme.title: Primal Fear
programme.desc: A publicity-seeking Chicago lawyer (Richard Gere) vies with an embittered ex-lover (Laura Linney) prosecuting an altar boy (Edward Norton) in a high-profile murder case.

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: While in jail for murdering her husband (Bruce Greenwood), a woman (Ashley Judd) discovers he is living under a new identity with their son.

programme.title: Marlowe
programme.desc: Detective Phillip Marlowe becomes embroiled in an investigation with a wealthy family in Bay City, Calif., after a beautiful blonde hires him to find her former lover.

programme.title: Dressed to Kill
programme.desc: A psychiatrist (Michael Caine), a prostitute (Nancy Allen) and the son of a slain woman (Angie Dickinson) seek a Manhattan slasher.

programme.title: Primal Fear
programme.desc: A publicity-seeking Chicago lawyer (Richard Gere) vies with an embittered ex-lover (Laura Linney) prosecuting an altar boy (Edward Norton) in a high-profile murder case.

programme.title: Jacob's Ladder
programme.desc: A Vietnam vet prone to flashbacks walks the edge of sanity as he searches for the cause of his nightmarish visions.

programme.title: The Shootist
programme.desc: People pester an old, dying gunfighter (John Wayne) rooming with a widow (Lauren Bacall) in 1901 Nevada.

programme.title: The Shootist
programme.desc: People pester an old, dying gunfighter (John Wayne) rooming with a widow (Lauren Bacall) in 1901 Nevada.

programme.title: Dances With Wolves
programme.desc: Costner's epic vision of the American frontier as seen through the eyes of a 19th-century U.S. Cavalry officer.

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: A slain Manhattan yuppie (Patrick Swayze) reaches out to his lover (Demi Moore), with a medium (Whoopi Goldberg) as his middlewoman.

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: While in jail for murdering her husband (Bruce Greenwood), a woman (Ashley Judd) discovers he is living under a new identity with their son.

programme.title: Marlowe
programme.desc: Detective Phillip Marlowe becomes embroiled in an investigation with a wealthy family in Bay City, Calif., after a beautiful blonde hires him to find her former lover.

programme.title: Jason's Lyric
programme.desc: A TV salesman falls for a spirited waitress and clashes with his wayward brother, as their lives reconnect in inner-city Houston.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to create revolutionary music that changes the world.

programme.title: Menace II Society
programme.desc: Crime, street sense and the status quo roil the mind of a teenager (Tyrin Turner) in the Watts section of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: Music comes first for a Manhattan jazzman (Denzel Washington) with one too many lovers and a manager (Spike Lee) who gambles.

programme.title: American Fiction
programme.desc: Fed up with the establishment that profits from Black entertainment that relies on tired and offensive tropes, a frustrated novelist writes an outlandish book of his own that propels him to the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.

programme.title: Challengers
programme.desc: Tensions run high when a grand slam tennis champion finds himself standing across the net from the once-promising, now burnt-out Patrick, his former best friend and his wife's former boyfriend.

programme.title: The Grifters
programme.desc: A con man (John Cusack) makes a no-win triangle with his mother (Anjelica Huston) and his girlfriend (Annette Bening).

programme.title: Fiddler on the Roof
programme.desc: A poor Jewish milkman (Topol) and his wife (Norma Crane) try to marry off their five daughters in czarist Russia.

programme.title: Everybody Wants Some!!
programme.desc: In 1980 Texas, a college freshman (Blake Jenner) meets his new baseball teammates (Will Brittain, Ryan Guzman), an unruly group of disco-dancing, skirt-chasing partyers.

programme.title: Menace II Society
programme.desc: Crime, street sense and the status quo roil the mind of a teenager (Tyrin Turner) in the Watts section of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: Music comes first for a Manhattan jazzman (Denzel Washington) with one too many lovers and a manager (Spike Lee) who gambles.

programme.desc: Fed up with the establishment that profits from Black entertainment that relies on tired and offensive tropes, a frustrated novelist writes an outlandish book of his own that propels him to the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
programme.desc: Complications arise after two bachelors (Rupert Everett, Colin Firth) make use of the same pseudonym in 19th-century England.

programme.title: Just Like Heaven
programme.desc: A San Francisco widower (Mark Ruffalo) falls in love with a ghostly doctor (Reese Witherspoon) while subletting her apartment.

programme.title: Overboard
programme.desc: A yachtsman's (Edward Herrmann) wife (Goldie Hawn) falls overboard, forgets who she is and becomes an Oregon carpenter's (Kurt Russell) mate.

programme.title: Overboard
programme.desc: Kate is a single, working-class mother of three who's fired by a selfish, spoiled and wealthy Mexican playboy named Leonardo. When Leonardo falls off his yacht and wakes up with amnesia, Kate seeks payback by convincing him that they're married.

programme.title: Hello, My Name Is Doris
programme.desc: With help from her best friend's (Tyne Daly) granddaughter (Isabella Acres), a smitten woman (Sally Field) concocts schemes to get the attention of a younger co-worker (Max Greenfield) in her office.

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: A freak accident gives a Chicago advertising executive (Mel Gibson) the ability to read women's minds.

programme.title: Just Like Heaven
programme.desc: A San Francisco widower (Mark Ruffalo) falls in love with a ghostly doctor (Reese Witherspoon) while subletting her apartment.

programme.title: Into the Blue 2: The Reef
programme.desc: Two professional divers (Chris Carmack, Laura Vandervoort) fight for their lives when they encounter criminals in Hawaiian waters.

programme.desc: Two professional divers (Chris Carmack, Laura Vandervoort) fight for their lives when they encounter criminals in Hawaiian waters.

programme.title: Downhill Racer
programme.desc: A cocky American (Robert Redford) skis and apres-skis Europe, training with his coach (Gene Hackman) for the Olympics.

programme.title: Stardust
programme.desc: To win the heart of his beloved, a young man (Charlie Cox) ventures into the realm of fairies to retrieve a fallen star (Claire Danes).

programme.desc: A linguistics professor (Amy Adams) leads an elite team of investigators in a race against time to communicate with extraterrestrial visitors.

programme.title: Looper
programme.desc: A mob hit man (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) comes to the chilling realization that his latest assignment is his older self (Bruce Willis), sent back in time by his bosses.

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: As a comet is on a collision course with earth, humans have to prepare for their survival. They randomly select eight hundred thousand people to be saved in order to keep the human race alive.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: Divorce Court
programme.desc: The venerable courtroom show takes a look at real-life couples. This is the third incarnation of the show titled "Divorce Court," with the first having premiered in 1957.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: Paging Dr. Chanda
programme.desc: Dr. Chanda interviews various influencers, creators, entertainers, and other mental health professionals about their mental health journeys.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: Divorce Court
programme.desc: The venerable courtroom show takes a look at real-life couples. The soon-to-be exes tell their stories to the judge, who gives the ruling and settles all the usual -- and unusual -- divorce issues by the end of the episode. This is the third incarnation of the show titled "Divorce Court," with the first having premiered in 1957.
